segment.source: Upgrade to Windows 10 with System Center Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Upgrade to Windows 10 with System Center Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: The simplest path to upgrade PCs currently running Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1 to Windows 10 is through an in-place upgrade.
segment.target: The simplest path to upgrade PCs currently running Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1 to Windows 10 is through an in-place upgrade.

segment.source: You can use a System Center Configuration Manager task sequence to completely automate the process.
segment.target: You can use a System Center Configuration Manager task sequence to completely automate the process.

segment.source: Upgrade to Windows 10 with System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: Upgrade to Windows 10 with System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: The simplest path to upgrade PCs currently running Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1 to Windows 10 is through an in-place upgrade.
segment.target: The simplest path to upgrade PCs currently running Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1 to Windows 10 is through an in-place upgrade.

segment.source: You can use a System Center Configuration Manager task sequence to completely automate the process.
segment.target: You can use a System Center Configuration Manager task sequence to completely automate the process.

segment.source: Proof-of-concept environment
segment.target: Proof-of-concept environment

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use four machines: DC01, CM01, and PC0003.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use four machines: DC01, CM01, and PC0003.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard machine, fully patched with the latest security updates, and configured as a member server in the fictional contoso.com domain.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard machine, fully patched with the latest security updates, and configured as a member server in the fictional contoso.com domain.

segment.source: PC0003 is a machine with Windows 7 SP1, targeted for the Windows 10 upgrade.
segment.target: PC0003 is a machine with Windows 7 SP1, targeted for the Windows 10 upgrade.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: figure 1
segment.target: figure 1

segment.source: Figure 1.
segment.target: Figure 1.

segment.source: The machines used in this topic.
segment.target: The machines used in this topic.

segment.source: Upgrade to Windows 10 with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager
segment.target: Upgrade to Windows 10 with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager

segment.source: System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 adds support to manage and deploy Windows 10.
segment.target: System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 adds support to manage and deploy Windows 10.

segment.source: Although it does not include built-in support to perform an in-place upgrade from Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, you can build a custom task sequence to perform the necessary tasks.
segment.target: Although it does not include built-in support to perform an in-place upgrade from Windows 7, Windows 8, or Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, you can build a custom task sequence to perform the necessary tasks.

segment.source: Create the task sequence
segment.target: Create the task sequence

segment.source: To help with this process, the Configuration Manager team has published a blog that provides a sample task sequence, as well as the original blog that includes the instructions for setting up the task sequence.
segment.target: To help with this process, the Configuration Manager team has published a blog that provides a sample task sequence, as well as the original blog that includes the instructions for setting up the task sequence.

segment.source: To summarize, here are the tasks you need to perform:
segment.target: To summarize, here are the tasks you need to perform:

segment.source: Download the Windows10Upgrade1506.zip file that contains the sample task sequence and related scripts.
segment.target: Download the Windows10Upgrade1506.zip file that contains the sample task sequence and related scripts.

segment.source: Extract the contents onto a network share.
segment.target: Extract the contents onto a network share.

segment.source: Copy the Windows 10 Enterprise RTM x64 media into the extracted but empty Windows vNext Upgrade Media folder.
segment.target: Copy the Windows 10 Enterprise RTM x64 media into the extracted but empty Windows vNext Upgrade Media folder.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager Console, right-click the Task Sequences node, and then choose Import Task Sequence.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager Console, right-click the Task Sequences node, and then choose Import Task Sequence.

segment.source: Select the Windows-vNextUpgradeExport.zip file that you extracted in Step 1.
segment.target: Select the Windows-vNextUpgradeExport.zip file that you extracted in Step 1.

segment.source: Distribute the two created packages (one contains the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 media, the other contains the related scripts) to the Configuration Manager distribution point.
segment.target: Distribute the two created packages (one contains the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 media, the other contains the related scripts) to the Configuration Manager distribution point.

segment.source: For full details and an explanation of the task sequence steps, review the full details of the two blogs that are referenced above.
segment.target: For full details and an explanation of the task sequence steps, review the full details of the two blogs that are referenced above.

segment.source: Create a device collection
segment.target: Create a device collection

segment.source: After you create the upgrade task sequence, you can create a collection to test a deployment.
segment.target: After you create the upgrade task sequence, you can create a collection to test a deployment.

segment.source: In this section, we assume you have the PC0003 machine running Windows 7 SP1, with the Configuration Manager client installed.
segment.target: In this section, we assume you have the PC0003 machine running Windows 7 SP1, with the Configuration Manager client installed.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.

segment.source: Use the following settings:
segment.target: Use the following settings:

segment.source: General
segment.target: General

segment.source: Name: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade
segment.target: Name: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade

segment.source: Limited Collection: All Systems
segment.target: Limited Collection: All Systems

segment.source: Membership rules:
segment.target: Membership rules:

segment.source: Direct rule
segment.target: Direct rule

segment.source: Resource Class: System Resource
segment.target: Resource Class: System Resource

segment.source: Attribute Name: Name
segment.target: Attribute Name: Name

segment.source: Value: PC0003
segment.target: Value: PC0003

segment.source: Select Resources
segment.target: Select Resources

segment.source: Select PC0003
segment.target: Select PC0003

segment.source: Review the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection.
segment.target: Review the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection.

segment.source: Do not continue until you see the PC0003 machine in the collection.
segment.target: Do not continue until you see the PC0003 machine in the collection.

segment.source: Deploy the Windows 10 upgrade
segment.target: Deploy the Windows 10 upgrade

segment.source: In this section, you create a deployment for the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Update application.
segment.target: In this section, you create a deployment for the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Update application.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then select Deploy.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then select Deploy.

segment.source: On the General page, select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the General page, select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Content page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Content page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Deployment Settings page, select the following settings, and then click Next:
segment.target: On the Deployment Settings page, select the following settings, and then click Next:

segment.source: Action: Install
segment.target: Action: Install

segment.source: Purpose: Available
segment.target: Purpose: Available

segment.source: On the Scheduling page, accept the default settings, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Scheduling page, accept the default settings, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the User Experience page, accept the default settings, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the User Experience page, accept the default settings, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Alerts page, accept the default settings, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Alerts page, accept the default settings, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.
segment.target: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.

segment.source: Start the Windows 10 upgrade
segment.target: Start the Windows 10 upgrade

segment.source: In this section, you start the Windows 10 Upgrade task sequence on PC0003 (currently running Windows 7 SP1).
segment.target: In this section, you start the Windows 10 Upgrade task sequence on PC0003 (currently running Windows 7 SP1).

segment.source: On PC0003, start the Software Center.
segment.target: On PC0003, start the Software Center.

segment.source: Select the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then click Install.
segment.target: Select the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then click Install.

segment.source: When the task sequence begins, it will automatically initiate the in-place upgrade process by invoking the Windows setup program (Setup.exe) with the necessary command-line parameters to perform an automated upgrade, which preserves all data, settings, apps, and drivers.
segment.target: When the task sequence begins, it will automatically initiate the in-place upgrade process by invoking the Windows setup program (Setup.exe) with the necessary command-line parameters to perform an automated upgrade, which preserves all data, settings, apps, and drivers.

segment.source: figure 2
segment.target: figure 2

segment.source: Figure 2.
segment.target: Figure 2.

segment.source: Upgrade from Windows 7 to Windows 10 Enterprise x64 with a task sequence.
segment.target: Upgrade from Windows 7 to Windows 10 Enterprise x64 with a task sequence.

segment.source: After the task sequence finishes, the computer will be fully upgraded to Windows 10.
segment.target: After the task sequence finishes, the computer will be fully upgraded to Windows 10.

segment.source: Upgrade to Windows 10 with the next version of System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: Upgrade to Windows 10 with the next version of System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: With the next release of System Center Configuration Manager (currently planned for Q4 of 2015), new built-in functionality will be provided to make it even easier to upgrade existing Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 8.1 PCs to Windows 10.
segment.target: With the next release of System Center Configuration Manager (currently planned for Q4 of 2015), new built-in functionality will be provided to make it even easier to upgrade existing Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 8.1 PCs to Windows 10.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more details about the next version of Configuration Manager, see the Configuration Manager Team blog.
segment.target: For more details about the next version of Configuration Manager, see the Configuration Manager Team blog.

segment.source: An evaluation version is currently available for you to try.
segment.target: An evaluation version is currently available for you to try.

segment.source: The instructions below are specific to the Technical Preview 2 release and may change after the next version of Configuration Manager is released.
segment.target: The instructions below are specific to the Technical Preview 2 release and may change after the next version of Configuration Manager is released.

segment.source: Create the OS upgrade package
segment.target: Create the OS upgrade package

segment.source: First, you need to create an operating system upgrade package that contains the full Windows 10 Enterprise x64 installation media.
segment.target: First, you need to create an operating system upgrade package that contains the full Windows 10 Enterprise x64 installation media.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Operating System Upgrade Packages node, then select Add Operating System Upgrade Package.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Operating System Upgrade Packages node, then select Add Operating System Upgrade Package.

segment.source: On the Data Source page, specify the UNC path to the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 media, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Data Source page, specify the UNC path to the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 media, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the General page, specify Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the General page, specify Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.
segment.target: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.

segment.source: Right-click the created Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Update package, and then select Distribute Content.
segment.target: Right-click the created Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Update package, and then select Distribute Content.

segment.source: Choose the CM01 distribution point.
segment.target: Choose the CM01 distribution point.

segment.source: Create the task sequence
segment.target: Create the task sequence

segment.source: To create an upgrade task sequence, perform the following steps:
segment.target: To create an upgrade task sequence, perform the following steps:

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Task Sequences node, and then select Create Task Sequence.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Task Sequences node, and then select Create Task Sequence.

segment.source: On the Create a new task sequence page, select Upgrade an operating system from upgrade package, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Create a new task sequence page, select Upgrade an operating system from upgrade package, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Task Sequence Information page, specify Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Task Sequence Information page, specify Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Upgrade the Windows operating system page, select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade operating system upgrade package, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Upgrade the Windows operating system page, select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade operating system upgrade package, and then click Next.

segment.source: Click Next through the remaining wizard pages, and then click Close.
segment.target: Click Next through the remaining wizard pages, and then click Close.

segment.source: figure 3
segment.target: figure 3

segment.source: Figure 3.
segment.target: Figure 3.

segment.source: The Configuration Manager vNext upgrade task sequence.
segment.target: The Configuration Manager vNext upgrade task sequence.

segment.source: Create a device collection
segment.target: Create a device collection

segment.source: After you create the upgrade task sequence, you can create a collection to test a deployment.
segment.target: After you create the upgrade task sequence, you can create a collection to test a deployment.

segment.source: In this section, we assume you have the PC0003 machine running Windows 7 SP1, with the next version of System Center Configuration Manager client installed.
segment.target: In this section, we assume you have the PC0003 machine running Windows 7 SP1, with the next version of System Center Configuration Manager client installed.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.

segment.source: Use the following settings:
segment.target: Use the following settings:

segment.source: General
segment.target: General

segment.target: Name: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade

segment.target: Limited Collection: All Systems

segment.target: Membership rules:

segment.target: Direct rule

segment.target: Resource Class: System Resource

segment.target: Attribute Name: Name

segment.source: Value: PC0003
segment.target: Value: PC0003

segment.source: Select Resources
segment.target: Select Resources

segment.source: Select PC0003
segment.target: Select PC0003

segment.source: Review the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection.
segment.target: Review the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection.

segment.source: Do not continue until you see the PC0003 machine in the collection.
segment.target: Do not continue until you see the PC0003 machine in the collection.

segment.source: Deploy the Windows 10 upgrade
segment.target: Deploy the Windows 10 upgrade

segment.source: In this section, you create a deployment for the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Update application.
segment.target: In this section, you create a deployment for the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Update application.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then select Deploy.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, right-click the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then select Deploy.

segment.source: On the General page, select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the General page, select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Upgrade collection, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Content page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Content page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Deployment Settings page, select the following settings and click Next:
segment.target: On the Deployment Settings page, select the following settings and click Next:

segment.source: Action: Install
segment.target: Action: Install

segment.source: Purpose: Available

segment.source: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.
segment.target: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.

segment.source: Start the Windows 10 upgrade
segment.target: Start the Windows 10 upgrade

segment.source: In this section, you start the Windows 10 Upgrade task sequence on PC0003 (currently running Windows 7 SP1).
segment.target: In this section, you start the Windows 10 Upgrade task sequence on PC0003 (currently running Windows 7 SP1).

segment.source: On PC0003, start the Software Center.
segment.target: On PC0003, start the Software Center.

segment.source: Select the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then click Install.
segment.target: Select the Windows vNext Upgrade task sequence, and then click Install.

segment.source: When the task sequence begins, it automatically initiates the in-place upgrade process by invoking the Windows setup program (Setup.exe) with the necessary command-line parameters to perform an automated upgrade, which preserves all data, settings, apps, and drivers.
segment.target: When the task sequence begins, it automatically initiates the in-place upgrade process by invoking the Windows setup program (Setup.exe) with the necessary command-line parameters to perform an automated upgrade, which preserves all data, settings, apps, and drivers.

segment.source: After the task sequence completes, the computer will be fully upgraded to Windows 10.
segment.target: After the task sequence completes, the computer will be fully upgraded to Windows 10.
